page.title: 04 Wilde Street
page.content: The small hamlet of Wilde Street was named after a Dr.Wilde, an old English name. The Street dates back to Roman times and Roman coins and artefacts have been found in local fields. There are 25 bungalows,5 houses,9 flint cottages,6 farms,a {coal merchant},and a {builder}. There was a pond at the end of Wildmere Lane,where reeds used to be cut for thatching,but this pond has dried up. Another pond has been enlarged by a farmer,an island added and the pond stocked with wild life. Apart from wild birds, there are pheasants,peacocks,fancy hens and other exotic birds reared by the farmer. Breach Drove was where the residents used to collect their water from a well. One resident remembers collecting water using a yoke and two buckets.
